The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Botryophora kingii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
